metadata.title: CVE-2020-6923 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
The HP Linux Imaging and Printing (HPLIP) software may potentially beaffected by memory buffer overflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-6923` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hpijs-ppds - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
hplip - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
hplip-data - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
hplip-gui - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
libhpmud0 - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
libsane-hpaio - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
printer-driver-hpcups - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
printer-driver-hpijs - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
printer-driver-postscript-hp - 3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: hplip package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.23.12+dfsg0-0ubuntu5').
